heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 09 November 2025 when 47.89mm fell at a maximum rate of 24.6mm per hour over the 144.8 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 34.3mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 144.8 hours on 09 November 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 24.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 47.89mm.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: An active storm has been detected in the vicinity.  The last storm experienced was on 02 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 3 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.6.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 0 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (191°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 128.2 mph on 27 January 2026.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden rainfall (up 0.4 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 187 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.1 mm) and inside temperature (up 1.8°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 187.1m lower than yesterday, 25.7m higher than the past week, 33.7m higher than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 530m to 1993m and averaged 823.7m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be low, possibly causing overcast or foggy conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, dry and less humid conditions and winds will be practically absent. Drizzle or light rain possible, cloud cover will be low, possibly causing overcast or foggy conditions, and it’s dim outside. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.

washing.phrase: The current weather conditions are not suitable as it is raining.
